U.S. Moves to Stifle DPRK Assailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly issued a statement on March 4 in denunciation of the ever more malicious moves of the United States to suffocate the DPRK under the slogan of "democracy".
 Recalling that the U.S. administration tendered the so-called "ADVANCE Democracy Act" to both Houses of Congress on March 3, the statement said the bill was brought forward against the background of the "North Korean Human Rights Act", the remarks of the second-term Bush administration about the "outpost of tyranny," the "annual report on human rights" and the forthcoming large-scale joint military drills.    
 The bill, in a nutshell, is an evil one to step up the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK under the cloak of "democracy" and "freedom", the statement noted. It bitterly denounced the makers of the act for pointing at the north as the chief target in all the points of the bill.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mauritius 
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Anerood Jugnauth, president of Mauritius, on Mar. 8 on the occasion of the 37th anniversary of its independence and the 13th anniversary of the proclamation of the republic.
 The message sincerely wished the president, government and people of the country greater success in their efforts for the prosperity of the country and peace and security in the Indian Ocean and expressed the belief that the good ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger on the basis of the idea of independence, peace and friendship in the future, too.
